Comments: I asked how to move forward getting our tax exempt status and was given an email address that just bounced back

The winds of change are upon us. As times evolve, so must our ways of communicating and working. You must now collaborate with independent writers, embracing fresh perspectives and ideas. This is not a threat to tradition; instead, it's an invitation to innovate and adapt. We must recognize that today's children will soon inherit the world we leave behind. It's imperative we prepare them for the unexpected twists and turns that lie ahead, equipping them with the knowledge and adaptability they'll need. We should not fear change but embrace it. By accepting and adapting to changes sooner rather than later, we ensure a smoother transition for everyone involved. The fabric of our future is being woven today, and we must ensure our children are ready to uphold the balance in the ever-evolving landscape. Thank you for being a part of this journey. Together, let's create a future where the next generation thrives. Thx Dimitri Gilles

This was the first time I used the QR code to access your website. Prior to this, the teacher handed out the flyer, you made your choices, wrote out a check, and sent the order with your check back to the teacher. I liked the idea of the app, because I don’t have to worry about lost orders, money, or checks.   However, I found your app difficult to navigate if you are not technically inclined. When you enter the grade level, it would be beneficial if the latest flyer came up. It took me quite a while to find it, and I am technically savvy. I used to have a classroom account until I retired.   When I signed in as a parent/family member, I kept getting routed to my old account. That has been resolved thanks to the customer service rep. When I finally got to shop, I had to search for the current flyer.

I purchased a e-gift card. Applied it to my daughter's account. When she went to get her books it said she has a zero balance. I went back to the gift card info  to see if maybe it never transfered and it said my card was invalid. My daughter was very upset and I am angry. Where is my $20?

I have called twice about the same thing.  I think the customer service person did the best they could but the issue hasn't been resolved yet.  Part of it is mail I believe.  However in the past we have always received our scholastic book order fliers with plenty of time.  At this point we still haven't received our September fliers and we are halfway through September.  I also haven't yet received my Scholastic Big World booklets for September.  I received October but not September.  The first person I spoke with said I should receive our book order fliers last Thursday (September 14) by noon.  Friday we still hadn't received them so I called again and they said I should get them but in case they would mail out a second set.  If that takes 7-10 business days we won't get them until September 26+/- and by then we are almost at the end of the month.  Hopefully next month will go more smoothly and we get them out in a timely manner.

I replied and tried to see if they will fix the problem.  As of right now, it is still not resolved.  My family order was submitted without my teacher order (although my credit card was on file).  My teacher order would have pushed the total order over $100 in order to earn the extra 500 bonus points.  I tried to submit my teacher order AFTER Scholastic submitted my order for me (which I did not care for them to do).  When I tried to submit my order so that it would be combined, there was a $6.95 shipping charge added to my $2 book.  IF Scholastic would NOT have submitted my order for me, I would have had an order over $100, with my extra 500 bonus points, I would have gotten my teacher order in, and I would have been able to get my item that I wanted with my bonus points.
Is Scholastic deliberately making life harder?

I wasn't aware of the change until now and will have to pay out of my own pocket for half of the cost for each set of books for my class every month in order to keep my promise to them. Without the $1 books I will no longer be able to do this amazing program I have done for years and giving a home library to students.

I am very disappointed that you have decided to make "fixed" due dates for orders.  Teachers should not be held to these dates. Having a set date might make it easier for Scholastic, but it certainly does not make it easier for teachers and should not be touted as if it does.

Eliminate the imposed DUE DATE or at least allow educators to modify. I have used Scholastic for years and will continue to be a patron.  However, as previously mentioned, I am not nor will I ever agree with the imposed DUE DATE policy.

Yes, I needed tax exempt status on an order I had placed using a PO. I was contacted by Chris  Case ID 9921521 with this response "I do see that your school has a tax exemption certificate on file. Please wait until you receive notification that your order has shipped and then submit your request for a new invoice. This will allow time for the order's bill to be processed and we will be happy to remove the tax at that time and send you a new invoice. I apologize for any inconvenience." This is very frustrating, Tax Exempt should be applied automatically to the order. I should not have to make several contacts with your company to receive this deduction. It should be automatic.

There’s no reason why I should not have been in your system. My parents could not order right away and I was never told of anything I needed to do. I do not like the new flyer or the prices. As a teacher, I am disappointed in the new policies that we just found out about.  They started before our school year and so we were not prepared with our budgets to make the necessary changes in ordering our classroom sets.  We often receive donations to purchase classroom sets that we give to our students at the end of each month.  We were not prepared to meet the new Scholastic imposed deadlines.  Also, all the prices have gone up quite a bit.  Unfortunately, we understand this is a nation wide issue, but this year's donations we sought are not going to cover the new expenses.  Last year the books we purchased were around $2.00 a book.  This year we cannot find things for our Kindergarteners that are less than $4.00 a book.  We will struggle to provide these to our students at these costs.  We work in a Title 1 school, where most of our students come from poverty.
I would love to be able to edit the due date. I don’t always want the orders due when the preset date is, and it causes confusion with parents.

for the past 15 years, I've started the year by 'selling' Scholastic book clubs because of the the 10,000 bonus point offer. I use that to supply my students who cannot afford to buy books themselves with books. This is not available this year, which totally hamstrings my efforts to get books into the hands of my most needy students. I am VERY disappointed. Last year, my order totaled more than $1000. I will not be using Scholastic Book Clubs unless the bonus point incentives are improved.

I am very disappointed in the new system.   The paper copy of the book order is terrible.  Why waste the time printing it if it is so minimal.  Not worth giving out to students.  Also, the idea that everything is on line is a very poor choice.  Yes it is a great option for many. But, our school has many many  families without internet access-  yes the is true.  Many do not have , or will not purchase on line for a variety of reasons.  Yes I can place that order but with he junky flyer, there is not much for them to choose from.   I am going to bet that I will not have many orders this year, unfortunately.   It was something that we looked forward to each month.  Also,  did I read that tax is now being placed on the books as well so it's not the straight cost anymore?  How sad that once again we are taking money away from the people who need it the most.  I hope you think about making some changes.

Fixed the problem the first time.  Should not have told me problem was fixed without checking.

The gal was very nice and I know the concerns we spoke about were not her doing, but we are not happy as educators about the changes Scholastic made about no place on the book orders to enter orders. MANY families have no internet, etc. to place orders online. Also, choosing to only send out grade level book forms, excludes every single student who is not at grade level. For most high poverty schools, this excludes more than half the class. By Scholastic trying to cut corners, they have excluded many students AND made more work for educators. Perhaps, getting more input from educators before making such drastic changes would have been a better, more inclusive option. The customer service representative was great; it is Scholastic that we we are disappointed in.

I was concerned because I have not received my paper flyers for book orders. Karen, informed me that they had already been sent but then said that I didn't have any kids listed on my profile. It was very confusing to understand what she was saying, and it felt like I was an inconvenience for her-it came off rude.

I asked for my class code during 2 different conversations.  The response was both was the copy and pasted response of parents can look for me on the site.  I am from an low income school where a lot of them may not have access to good, if any internet.  Finally I was explained that you no longer give codes.  I truly do not like this, as I feel like it will distance parents from actually wanting to take the time to search for me which in turn will lower the chance of books being purchased.  Many of these parents do not know how to read, are not interested in reading, don't want to/have the time, to search for me.  Some probably do not even know my name. I do not like the way this is now set up.

Each response was done in a timely manner and I do appreciate that.  My issue is with the new ordering process.  I feel as though it is not equitable.  I service a low income community where many families face daily challenges such as limited to no English, inability to read, financial hardships, and well as limited internet access. Removing the paper order form also deletes a good % of families to order.

I don't understand how the new flyers work- no classroom due date, no classroom code. How do the parents know to order under my classroom/name? I was told the QR code is generic and doesn't link to my classroom orders at all.

I need the ability to set my own due date as I have since 1986. I was told this was impossible.

I do not feel the set due dates for Scholastic is helping my Scholastic experience. In my long time customer opinion, it is taking away flexibility for the teacher while making shipping dates easier for Scholastic.

I contacted support for not being able to change my due date for my class. The person told me she is not able to change that and that is that across the board. I would like to change my due date bc I like to send my flyers out at certain parts of the month. I went to send mine home yesterday (middle of the month) but It was saying that the parents had to place their order by the 13th which was yesterday. The representative said that she couldn't change it and that yall did this to help teachers out. That is not the case. Not being in control of our own due date is frustrating. I didn't even get to send mine home at all and just trashed them because the due date was off for the parents and she said that they can place it whenever but wouldn't be send out until October something. How frustrating. They also asked if I just got my flyers in if that was why I didn't send them home yet. I informed them that I don't send home in the first few weeks of school because the start of school is expensive and hard on parents. I have been doing scholastic for 10+ plus years. (I didn't last year because I was out on maternity leave) So all of this to say Please let teachers be in charge of their own due dates again! Teachers are not able to be in charge of their own due date!

My original email goes into detail about the problem, but basically your costs are too high for me and my families to continue using you. Especially without the September 10,000 Bonus points. That bonus supported my classroom most of the year. The other problem is not being able to change the book order due date. It is much cheaper and much more convenient to use Amazon at this point. Adjust your prices and give better teacher incentives.

I am bummed that you aren't offering the $1 book of the week deal anymore. I totally understand that prices everywhere are going up, but it was a really great way for me to get kids books to take home because I was buying them with my own money. Even just a $1 increase doubles my cost now. I work in a small, rural, low SES school and this was one of the best ways to get books home for reading practice.
I'm just upset you dropped all of the younger age groups flyers.  We have to drop out now. Just that I'm disappointed.

I was very surprised to see the changes with your catalog this year. I usually hand out 2-4 catalogs that give parents lots of selections. There was a very limited selection at this point. I hope it changes in the future. I do not see my parents ordering very often based on the catalog I recieved.

No changes are on the horizon. Just received 2 lengthy responses that makes it seem like feedback is not really listened to.  One suggestion was to create my own form for parents to be able to fill out and keep track of who ordered what so families who do not have access to online payments or internet can order.  This creates more work.  The set due date is also frustrating because it is very confusing to have different from what it is from the classroom.  Again, the feedback was not really listened to.  I usually love customer service from Scholastic, and have spoken very highly of them in the past to others.  This time you are missing the mark.  I hope you are receiving other feedback from teachers, because this is what I am seeing all over social media right now. See previous comment.  I don't think there is any plans to change the issue, just telling us that Scholastic knows better for what works in our classrooms rather than what we know works.
